intro: Mesosphaerum lamiifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mesosphaerum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
